data.title: Sherlock Holmes Reimagined - The Indianapolis Public Library
data.meta_description: Sherlock Holmes Reimagined by IndyPL_KristenF - a staff-created list : Sherlock Holmes remains a popular character even 130 years after his first appearance in Sir Arthur Conan Doyle’s novel A Study In Scarlet.  Sherlock reimaginings and retellings have appeared in books, television, and movies for almost every age group.  Some are set in modern times while others remain in the Victorian era of Conan Doyle’s original stories.  Some feature a female lead, and some have supernatural elements.  The items in this list are some of my favorite Sherlock Holmes reimaginings.  #IndyPLadults #Sherlock
data.text:
Enola Holmes lives in the shadow of her two successful older brothers Mycroft and Sherlock Holmes. When their mother disappears, Sherlock and Mycroft ret...Show more Enola Holmes lives in the shadow of her two successful older brothers Mycroft and Sherlock Holmes. When their mother disappears, Sherlock and Mycroft return to the family estate to investigate, and they treat Enola like a helpless little girl. In Victorian days, girls and women were expected to be little more than decoration, but Enola isn’t having any of that. She is far from helpless and she embarks on an adventure to find her missing mother. I enjoyed seeing Enola gain confidence in herself through the course of this book and realize that she is just as capable of solving crimes as her brothers. Also available as an eBook and downloadable audiobook. Show less

This modern-day retelling features the ancestors of Sherlock Holmes and John Watson who both attend a boarding school in Connecticut. Charlotte Holmes is...Show more This modern-day retelling features the ancestors of Sherlock Holmes and John Watson who both attend a boarding school in Connecticut. Charlotte Holmes is a brilliant but broken girl who has inherited some of Sherlock’s bad habits, and Jamie Watson takes up the family tradition of looking after Holmes. After a student is murdered on campus Watson and Holmes are framed for the crime and they must work together to solve the case and clear their names. I had a hard time putting this book down. I particularly liked the similarities between Sherlock and Charlotte, but also the fact that she was a complex character in her own right, and not just a teenage girl version of Sherlock. Also available as an eBook and downloadable audiobook. Trigger warning: References to drug use and rape. Show less

Kareem Abdul-Jabbar is not only a basketball legend, but also an author and a Holmesian. Mycroft Holmes is the older brother of Sherlock and is usually l...Show more Kareem Abdul-Jabbar is not only a basketball legend, but also an author and a Holmesian. Mycroft Holmes is the older brother of Sherlock and is usually left as a background character, but Abdul-Jabbar and co-author Anna Waterhouse bring Mycroft to the forefront in this fast-paced and violent origin story. They paint 23 year old Mycroft in a more positive light than we are used to while also paving the way for his transformation into the hardened man we know from Sir Arthur Conan Doyle’s work. Available as a book and eBook. Show less

This is a parody of "A Study In Scarlet", the first book by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle to feature Sherlock Holmes. The story follows "A Study ...Show more This is a parody of "A Study In Scarlet", the first book by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle to feature Sherlock Holmes. The story follows "A Study in Scarlet" closely, with elements changed to incorporate the supernatural. As the title suggests, Holmes is a Warlock in this parody and various supernatural phenomena occur in the book. If you want a serious Holmes retelling skip this one, but I found it quite enjoyable. Even though it closely follows the original, the changes make it quirky and fun. I laughed out loud. Available as a book and eBook. Show less

A mashup of Sherlock Holmes and H.P. Lovecraft’s Cthulhu written by multiple-award-winning author Neil Gaiman, with artwork by Eisner Award winner Rafael ...Show more A mashup of Sherlock Holmes and H.P. Lovecraft’s Cthulhu written by multiple-award-winning author Neil Gaiman, with artwork by Eisner Award winner Rafael Albuquerque? Yes please! This is a retelling of Sir Arthur Conan Doyle’s book “A Study in Scarlet” with a Lovecraftian supernatural twist. Gaiman and Albuquerque’s combination of great writing and beautiful artwork create a perfect creepy, suspenseful, and horrific Victorian atmosphere, worthy of both Conan Doyle and Lovecraft. I absolutely loved it. Show less

In this great re-imagining of the iconic duo, Watson and Holmes are modern day African American men living in Harlem. They meet when Holmes, a PI, shows ...Show more In this great re-imagining of the iconic duo, Watson and Holmes are modern day African American men living in Harlem. They meet when Holmes, a PI, shows up at the hospital where Watson is a medical intern to speak with one of Watson’s patients regarding a missing girl. From there Watson is drawn into the mystery and the game is afoot! I like that Watson and Holmes are on a more equal level in this re-imagining, and that Lieutenant Stroud (this story’s version of Lestrade) is more capable. Show less

All copies in use Availability details

This is a fun chick-lit style mystery. Marty (Martha) inherits a house when an aunt she had never met passes away. Marty tries to get to know her aunt b...Show more This is a fun chick-lit style mystery. Marty (Martha) inherits a house when an aunt she had never met passes away. Marty tries to get to know her aunt by going through her belongings and talking to the neighbors, and as she learns more about her aunt’s life she discovers things that make her question the nature of her aunt’s death. The police are reluctant to give out information to a formerly unknown relative, so Marty and her friend Irene Adler create a fake private eye named Sherlock Holmes to investigate. Show less

This is a true story of Mary Grace Quackenbos, an attorney in an age when few women were allowed to go to law school. She founded a law firm to represent...Show more This is a true story of Mary Grace Quackenbos, an attorney in an age when few women were allowed to go to law school. She founded a law firm to represent the poor who would not otherwise be able to afford an attorney. She had a fascinating career and became the first female Special Assistant United States Attorney. Later in her career she earned the nickname “Mrs. Sherlock Holmes” after solving the cold case of a girl who had disappeared years earlier. This title is also available in other formats including large print, eBook, and downloadable audiobook. Show less

This graphic novel revolves around the “Baker Street Irregulars”, a group of street kids that Sherlock Holmes employs from time to time to gather informat...Show more This graphic novel revolves around the “Baker Street Irregulars”, a group of street kids that Sherlock Holmes employs from time to time to gather information. The Irregulars appeared in several of Sir Arthur Conan Doyle’s books. This volume contains two stories, told from the point of view of the Irregulars, as they run around London solving crimes and saving lives. The stories are fun and engaging and the artwork does a good job of capturing Victorian era London. Show less

This is a great collection of short stories about Sherlock Holmes written by Stephen King, Neil Gaiman, Laura King, Tanith Lee, and many more. The storie...Show more This is a great collection of short stories about Sherlock Holmes written by Stephen King, Neil Gaiman, Laura King, Tanith Lee, and many more. The stories bring new elements into the Holmesian universe, including science fiction, fantasy, and horror, in addition to the classic mysteries that fans love. Also available as an eBook. Show less

As you can tell from the title, this is not your typical Sherlock Holmes mystery. After a strange comet-like object casts an eerie green glow in the sky,...Show more As you can tell from the title, this is not your typical Sherlock Holmes mystery. After a strange comet-like object casts an eerie green glow in the sky, London becomes overrun by zombies. Holmes and Dr. Watson must dodge the undead as they solve the mystery of how the people of London became zombified. All of our favorite characters are represented in this gory tale. The combination of period-appropriate writing and good artwork creates a creepy vibe, with some good zombie gore thrown in. Show less

All copies in use Availability details

In this alternate timeline mystery, Sherlock is a real person, not a character, and Arthur Conan Doyle seeks him out to help with a case. It relates to ...Show more In this alternate timeline mystery, Sherlock is a real person, not a character, and Arthur Conan Doyle seeks him out to help with a case. It relates to Conan Doyle’s real life interest in spiritualism, which creates a fun mix of factual and fictional tale. In this reimagining, Mrs. Hudson is Sherlock’s partner in investigation instead of Dr. Watson. It’s an interesting concept and adds to the Sherlockian universe. Also available as an eBook. Show less

This is the manga adaptation of the popular BBC television series “Sherlock”. If you like the TV series, this is a fun way to experience it in a different format. This is the manga adaptation of the popular BBC television series “Sherlock”. If you like the TV series, this is a fun way to experience it in a different format. Show less
